page.title: 07AYMESTREY MILL
page.content: There has been a Mill at Aymestrey since at least the 10thC, the original Mill being mentioned in the Original Doomesday Book. The present Mill dates back to the early 1800s and was producing flour until the mid 1960s Today the Mill is in a good state of repair and in working condition. The old stables adjoining the Mill have been converted into a{printmaking {studio,}producing hand printed lithographic limited editions for artists. The Flat-bed{lithographic {press}is driven by gears, belts and pulley wheels from the{water wheel. In 1983 the present owner installed a{Water Turbine}which generates electricity for the heating and lighting of the property which he bought in 1974.
